cab.content: 1/2171330 S. Secret. Following is from Consul-General, Kashgar. dated 20th August, received Oth September.: " Afghans announce intention to appoint (Consul at) Kasligar. This would seem furthering Afghan-Kashgar (troublesome) schemes, possible subversion of British protected subjects and a menace to us generally. As no treaty between China and Afghanistan exists, Chinese would probably not recognise such appointment. Kashgar Taoyin without actually mentioning "Afghanistan has issued orders prohibiting foreigners from crossing the frontier pending his instructions," I will report any developments with a view to action being taken in Peking if necessary."
